title: Canada answers Ukraine’s call for satellite radar imagery
summary: Canada’s MDA Corp. will provide satellite radar imagery to Ukraine’s government to help it counter Russia’s invasion of that country. Canadian government sources say that RADARSAT-2 will be used to collect the data.

title: Congress finally delivers a budget, and NASA gets most of what it wants
summary: Congress's favorite rocket, of course, got extra funding, while science did not.

title: Omnibus spending bill includes $24 billion for NASA for 2022
summary: House and Senate appropriators completed work March 9 on an omnibus spending bill for fiscal year 2022 that would give NASA a little more than $24 billion, $760 million below the administration’s request.

title: SatixFy to go public through latest space SPAC deal
summary: Satellite communications equipment maker SatixFy said March 8 it has agreed to go public by merging with a special purpose acquisition company, shrugging off market uncertainty that helped dash weather startup Tomorrow.io’s SPAC plans the day before.

title: U.S. intelligence report: Multinational efforts needed to prevent wars in space
summary: The risk that conflicts on Earth will extend to space will grow as China and Russia step up developments of ant-satellite weapons, the U.S. intelligence community warns in its annual report.

title: Iran’s military successfully launches satellite
summary: U.S. military tracking radars confirmed claims from Iran’s Revolutionary Guard Corps Tuesday that the Iranian military placed a small satellite into orbit.

title: U.S. general: Starlink in Ukraine showing what megaconstellations can do
summary: U.S. Space Command has been impressed by SpaceX’s ability to provide internet access in war-torn parts of Ukraine, the head of the command told lawmakers March 8.

title: Long March rocket deploys six Chinese internet satellites
summary: Six demonstration satellites for a future Chinese broadband internet mega-constellation launched March 5 on a Long March 2C rocket.

title: SpaceX upgrading Starship noses and domes for easier assembly
summary: While a separate team closes in on the completion of a new and improved Starship nosecone, SpaceX also appears to have begun...

title: NASA's Angie Jackman Works to Develop Rocket That Will Bring Mars Samples to Earth
summary: Meet the project manager of the first rocket to launch from the surface of another planet, the Mars Ascent Vehicle.
